comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This is the tower over Governor Bourke's Statue in the Domain from where the previous panoramas ot the Botanical Gardens and Macquarie Street were taken.  I read about it on the State Library NSW website,  but can't remember the details,  as usual.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Here we are, all the details by the meticulous Alan Davies, photo curator of the Mitchell Library, SLNSW - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=413400 In the blurb - " ... a series of views of Sydney, taken by Freeman Brothers, from a chamber (45 ft high) erected over the statue of Sir Richard Bourke. The panorama was commissioned to assist architects in Europe to compete for designs for the intended new Houses of Parliament, on the site of the Orphan School. -- Reference: Sydney Morning Herald, 13 May 1859 `Photographic views of Sydney' p.9 `Sydney' 14 part panorama by Freeman Brothers, 1859, held in the Foreign and Commonwealth Office Library, London. -- Reference: The Winston Churchill Memorial Trust of Australia / report by Alan Davies, 1986 Fellow. Project: The location and identification of Australian photographs, particularly of the Nineteenth Century, in British Institutions. (p.15) "

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And the Sydney Morning Herald article mentioned above - SMH 13/5/1859 p.9 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13024896 .
